breweries.name: Inbound Brewco
breweries.description:
Inbound BrewCo is a craft brewery and taproom in the North Loop of Minneapolis. The 12,000 square foot taproom, a converted recycling facility, features German beer hall-style seating, enormous floor-to-ceiling windows, a walk around bar, and a private mezzanine. In warmer months, we open up the doors and add 50 seats to our sunny patio.

Order from one of our 30 craft beer taplines and rotating craft sodas and kombucha. Grab beer to go (growlers, crowlers, and bottles) and Inbound swag from our merch shop.

To learn what's going on in the taproom, check out our food truck calendar and events calendar. We host events from live music to local craft markets to brewery 5K's.

data.name: Vienna Lager
data.description: While “lager” generally conjures images of clear, yellow beer with a crisp character, this is a darker take on the style. The color tends toward a dark burgundy, with the Vienna malt in particular bringing a tinge of spice to the full, malt-forward body. Vanguard hops provide an earthy bedrock for this winter-friendly brew.

breweries.name: Oskar Blues Brewery
breweries.description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.

data.name: Vienna Lager
data.description: This is like Marzen’s little brother. Vienna, Marzen and Oktoberfest beers share a similar origin and fall into the same category of lagers. The Vienna is the lightest in color of the three. Vienna malt is a specially kilned malt that adds a particular aroma and flavor to the beer, as well as adding a fullness of body. We threw in some dark Munich malt, as well, to punch up the color just a bit.

breweries.name: Dust Bowl Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to Dust Bowl Brewing Company located in Turlock, Ca. We are a small brewing company in the Central Valley of California. Our size allows us to have a very personal and passionate connection to each of our beers. We are continuously testing new flavors and styles to develop our selection of beers. Our goal is to help create a thriving beer culture in the Central Valley.

Our company is a tribute to the strong-willed, gritty people of the Dust Bowl and Great Depression era. Inspired by the families who came west in search of a new start as well as those who stayed behind to weather the storm. This is great beer born of hard times. Storm’s comin’!

style.name: American-Style Premium Lager
style.description: This style has low malt (and adjunct) sweetness, is medium bodied, and should contain no or a low percentage (less than 25%) of adjuncts. Color may be light straw to golden. Alcohol content and bitterness may also be greater. Hop aroma and flavor is low or negligible. Light fruity esters are acceptable. Chill haze and diacetyl should be absent. Note: Some beers marketed as "premium" (based on price) may not fit this definition.

data.name: Vienna Lager
data.description: "My two previous brewing gigs were with breweries that heavily featured lagers in their portfolios, and amber lagers have a rich history in Pennsylvania. That made the choice of featuring a Vienna-style lager a no-brainer for us at Workhorse. Mild flavors of caramel and toffee blend harmoniously with hints of toasted nuts to produce an easy drinking beer accessible to both the novice and seasoned beer connoisseur. A cold fermentation with extended aging tempers this beer into a delightfully smooth lager that is sure to become a fan favorite."

breweries.name: Workhorse Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Here's something refreshing: we focus on making great beer and making it easy for people to enjoy it. Our mission, simply put, is to make sure your beer is made right. We take a no-nonsense approach to classic beer styles that are broadly appealing and consistently delicious.

 

Our founding members came together over a shared respect for the craft beer industry and a goal to create a brewery built on those values. As seasoned entrepreneurs and proud Philadelphians, we’ve crafted Workhorse to be a reflection of the community in which it resides: hard-working, approachable and earnest, all while maintaining an unwavering commitment to quality in all facets of the operation. We look forward to seeing you soon!

data.name: Vienna Lager
data.description: Community Beer Company’s deference to classic, old world European lagers manifests as our year round offering Community Vienna Lager.  A true lager, this beer takes about five to six weeks to make from the day we mill the malt to finished, sparkling clear beer.  This all malt, Vienna-style lager begins with our own crystal clear water – run through our state of the art filtration system – which is treated to mimic the waters of Bavaria, before being mashed with the finest malts from one of the oldest German maltsters.  Using traditional techniques, we craft this lager’s wort in our four vessel brewhouse, transferring it to our fermenters to settle in for the long haul that all true lagers must undergo.  Our European lager strain ferments very cold and slow, leaving a crisp, clean, highly quaffable, light copper colored beer.  While most of our beers are unfiltered, we feel it is vitally important to filter this delicate beer, allowing the drinker to appreciate the clean, subtle complexities of a truly world-class lager.

breweries.name: Community Beer Company
breweries.description:
BEER FOR THE GREATER GOOD.....

Community Beer Company represents many meanings --
all centered on what we feel a great Community represents.

FIRST: Beer is Communal. For ages, it’s been a central part of get-togethers among friends, family, and co-workers to celebrate old acquaintances ... or make new ones. 

SECOND: As a brewery, we are passionate about providing quality craft beer to the people within our Community: Dallas, Texas and the surrounding Metroplex. 

THIRD: We want to be stewards of our Community by adhering to environmentally sustainable business practices, production, and distribution. 

And FINALLY: We plan to become an integral part of our Community by giving back to it through charitable activities and supporting our local artists. 

Truly, Beer for the Greater Good!

breweries.name: Squatters Craft Beers
breweries.description:
Although much has changed (now three locations and a microbrewery), we remain firmly dedicated to our original goal; provide our customers world-class handcrafted beer and food in a warm, friendly environment.

As Squatters grew we embraced the Triple Bottom Line philosophy of People Planet Profit. We source healthy ingredients and use environmentally friendly products and services from within our local eco-region. We develop long-term relationships with farmers, growers and suppliers so we know exactly what is, and is not, in the products we buy. We choose to support local non-profit organizations. We buy BlueSky wind power and are continuously working to reduce our carbon footprint.

We believe these and other practices contribute to a healthy community and environment, locally and globally, making our city a better place to live, work, and drink world-class Squatters beers.

breweries.name: Portsmouth Brewery
breweries.description:
The Portsmouth Brewery, New Hampshire's first brewpub, was founded in 1991, four years after its sister company, the Northampton Brewery, opened in Western Massachusetts. Peter Egelston, Head Brewer in Northampton from 1987 until 1991, moved to Portsmouth to set up the new brewery here. (Egelston is now the sole proprietor of the Brewery.) 

The brewing system consists of a custom made seven-barrel (210 gallons) JV Northwest brewhouse, two fourteen-barrel and three seven-barrel JV Northwest unitank (cylindroconical) fermenters, two fourteen-barrel horizontal fermenters (added later, in 1994), and twelve seven-barrel grundy cellar tanks. Originally, the Portsmouth Brewery opened with beer recipes from Northampton - Pale Ale, Old Brown Dog, Weizenheimer, Black Cat Stout, Blonde Ale, Golden and Amber Lagers - and these still comprise the core of the Brewery's full-time beers today. However, over the years, successive brewers have contributed many outstanding seasonal and specialty beers to the list.  All of the beers served at the Portsmouth Brewery are brewed right here on premise, with the exception of those beers, such as Shoals Pale Ale and Portsmouth Lager, brewed at Smuttynose Brewing Company, our sister company.

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Saugatuck Brewing Company (SBC) has been a leading producer in the Michigan Craft Beer Industry since brewing its first beer in 2005. The brewery, located conveniently on Blue Star Highway in Douglas, Michigan, boasts two tasting rooms and outdoor patio dining. The Pub features 16 taps, hard cider, and wine along with a full food menu including everything from unique entrees to shareable appetizers. Free, live music increases the dining experience every Saturday at 6:00 pm, along with live music on the Patio every Thursday at 6:00 pm from Memorial Day to Labor Day. Along with the Pub, the Saugatuck Brewing Company recently added on a second tap room, which has been dubbed "The Barrel Room," including 15 additional taps and a variety of munchies. The Barrel Room is a laid-back tasting room where customers can enjoy a pint while playing a round of one of the many games featured, like shuffleboard, bumper pool, pinball and more.

Saugatuck Brewing Company is also proud to be the only location in the state of Michigan to offer a "Brew On Premise"  program, where customers can come in and brew their own beer on our 3.5 barrel Brew System located in the Pub. All of the beer offered at the Saugatuck Brewing Company is brewed on site on a 45 barrel Brew System in the 14,000 square foot Production Facility. Customers can tour the facility every Saturday at 2:00 pm for $7.50/person. Each tour includes a complimentary tasting and their choice of a logo'd pint glass or growler to take home.

The Saugatuck Brewing Company bottles 7 styles year round, including everything from a crisp Blonde Ale to exciting flavored stouts. SBC also offers a variety of interesting styles throughout the year as bottled seasonals, specialty releases and draft only beers. These beers can be found near and far, as they are distributed through 11 states (Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Ohio, Wisconsin, Missouri, Kentucky, Pennsylvania, Florida, New Jersey and Nebraska) along with 7 foreign markets  (United Kingdom, Western Canada, Germany, Trinidad & Tobago, Ukraine, China and South Korea). While the plan remains to grow these brands throughout the country and world, SBC will never forget that Michigan is where they are from, and where the heart is.

Saugatuck Brewing Company is located on the southwest coast of Michigan on Blue Star Highway, ½ mile North of Exit 36 on Interstate 196. Located in the community of Saugatuck/Douglas, which is known for it’s clean, beautiful beaches, sprawling sand dunes, and exciting night life; not to mention their delicious beer.

data.name: Vienna Lager
data.description: Robyn, who created our Vienna lager recipe, likes to pair this beer with bratwurst. Sho, another Moody Ales brewer, prefers it with carnitas. Makes sense—this style, originally developed in Vienna in the 1840s, lost popularity in Europe over the nineteenth century but thrived in Mexico with Austrian emigrant brewers. So, as you enjoy our malt-forward yet clean amber lager, remember that from Austria to Mexico to Canada, pork and beer unite us all.

breweries.name: Huss Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are a Quality Lager and Aleworks Brewery with focus on American Craft Beer.  We are located in the now defunct Rio Salado Brewery in South Tempe.  We have 2 taprooms in the Phoenix metro Area.

The original taproom is attached to the brewery in Tempe and offers 20 revolving handles of the beers made on site along with the best beers available in Arizona.

Our second taproom and neighborhood gathering place is located in the heart of Phoenix at the Uptown Plaza on Central + Camelback. This location also has a great limited menu of local sausages, Flatbreads sliders and nachos to enjoy with our hand crafted brews!

Two people with a lot of passion for Craft Beer.  Owned and operated by husband and wife team Jeff and Leah Huss.  Together they have 20 years experience in the Craft Beer Industry.  Jeff “Ginger” Huss graduated from the Siebel Institute of Brewing Technology and was the Head Brewer for BJ’s Brewery in Chandler Arizona for over Seven years.  Leah Huss graduated from Scottsdale Culinary Institute with a degree in Culinary Arts and has been the Managing Partner at the Papago Brewing Co. in Scottsdale since 2001.  Both share a love and passion for American Craft beer and it’s culture, and look forward to sharing their knowledge and experience with you!

breweries.name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
breweries.description:
TAPS Fish House & Brewery was founded in 1999. Many of our beers reflect the classic brewing traditions of Europe, including England, Germany, and Belgium, while others are indicative of the creativity and innovation that are the hallmarks of the American Craft Beer scene.

TAPS’ repertoire of ales and lagers is highly varied and reflects a nod to tradition with a focus on perfection and innovation. The brewing team produces approximately 3000 kegs, or 46,500 gallons of beer annually. Our brewers supply TAPS in Brea, Corona and Irvine, as well as our sister restaurants, The Catch in Anaheim and Lillie’s Q in Brea Downtown. TAPS also distributes fine beers to restaurants and pubs throughout Southern California. We have received national and international acclaim for barrel-aging programs, which produce cult classics such as Remy’s Pappy.

We source the finest ingredients from around the world and utilize the best brewing procedures to create truly great beer: “World Class in Every Glass.” The hops and barley are meticulously sourced in order to emulate the fine beers and brewing regions of the world.  We utilize proprietary strains of yeast, reverse osmosis filtration, and tailor our water chemistry and processes every time beer is made.

TAPS’ passion for perfection has been recognized on the regional, state, national and international levels—to date we have received over 87 medals for our fine beers. TAPS barrel-aged products have also garnered national and international acclaim and are treasured by collectors worldwide

breweries.name: Worth Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Backed by the support of countless friends and neighbors, Worth Brewing Company opened on March 17, 2007. Its owners, the husband-and-wife team of Peter Ausenhus and Margaret Bishop, have lived near Northwood since their purchase of a nearby farmhouse and acreage in 1998. Nebraska natives, Peter and Margaret lived and worked in Minneapolis for many years before moving to Worth County, where Peter’s grandparents had lived and farmed and where Peter had spent much time as a boy.

 Having already established Margaret’s engineering business in downtown Northwood, the couple turned next to Peter’s passion – brewing great beer. For 24 years, Peter has brewed award-winning beer, winning contests, teaching others and perfecting classic recipes along the way. He’s a BJCP National Beer Judge, has brewed professionally with Summit Brewing Company of St. Paul, Minn., and worked on staff at one of the country’s most popular brewing supply shops.

Worth Brewing Company is Peter and Margaret’s way of helping to reintroduce a great tradition – the locally owned brewery serving hand-crafted, high-quality, distinctive beers for the enjoyment of locals and lucky visitors. The nation’s small and mid-sized towns were once dotted with such breweries. Today, Worth Brewing – perhaps one of the world’s smallest craft brewers – brings a bit of those days back to delight the growing number of those who appreciate fine, locally brewed beers.

style.name: Münchner (Munich)-Style Helles
style.description: This beer should be perceived as having low bitterness. It is a medium-bodied, malt-emphasized beer with malt character often balanced with low levels of yeast produced sulfur compounds (character). Certain renditions of this beer style have  a perceivable level of hop flavor (note: hop flavor does not imply hop bitterness) and character but it is essentially balanced with malt character to retain its style identity. Malt character is sometimes bread-like yet always reminiscent of freshly and very lightly toasted malted barley. There should not be any caramel character. Color is light straw to golden. Fruity esters and diacetyl should not be perceived. There should be no chill haze.

breweries.name: Snowy Mountain Brewery
breweries.description:
The Snowy Mountain Brewery is located in beautiful Saratoga, Wyoming and is the anchor brewpub for the Saratoga Resort and Spa.  The Saratoga Resort and Spa consistently draws people from all over Colorado and Wyoming due to its unique offering of a variety of amenities in one location--such as an on-site brewery, mineral hot spring pools, great food, western-styled rooms, jeep, ATV and snowmobile rentals, a golf course and a full-service spa.  

The Snowy Mountain Brewery is gaining in exposure and was featured recently in Travel Pulse’s “5 Unique Beer Vacation Spots in the U.S.!”  The name Snowy Mountain is fitting for the brewery as it sits adjacent the majestic Snowy Range Mountains, in southern Wyoming. Boasting 8-10 different craft beers throughout each season, the Snowy Mountain Brewery is one of the fastest growing breweries in Wyoming and surrounding states. The famous brewpub, with a throw-back to the wild west, is adorned with big game mounts and bar-stools made with six-shooters and patinated saddles and features a full pub menu with selections that compliment Saratoga's finest craft beers.

breweries.name: Squatters Craft Beers
breweries.description:
Although much has changed (now three locations and a microbrewery), we remain firmly dedicated to our original goal; provide our customers world-class handcrafted beer and food in a warm, friendly environment.

As Squatters grew we embraced the Triple Bottom Line philosophy of People Planet Profit. We source healthy ingredients and use environmentally friendly products and services from within our local eco-region. We develop long-term relationships with farmers, growers and suppliers so we know exactly what is, and is not, in the products we buy. We choose to support local non-profit organizations. We buy BlueSky wind power and are continuously working to reduce our carbon footprint.

We believe these and other practices contribute to a healthy community and environment, locally and globally, making our city a better place to live, work, and drink world-class Squatters beers.

data.name: Vienna stock · Malzstrasse
data.description:
An ode to the malt - enjoyment as from another planet: The Malzstrasse, the Vienna stock Brew Age.
Already at first glance, the deep golden, slightly reddish color of the beer falls and makes it clear: The Malzstrasse is not a 08/15 mass beer.
The key player in our Vienna warehouse is the Vienna malt. This malt produces a complex but pleasant body with notes of biscuit. The subtle hop bitterness provides balance and refreshment.
And because we believe that an elegant hop flower beer touches the crown, we have refined it with the finest aroma hops from the Halltertau.

breweries.name: Brew Age
breweries.description:
How it all began and where the journey should go

It all started as a hobby in 2006 were brewing Tom and John in preserving pot their first beer. Apparently hats tasted, because it soon emerged that there should be more than just a hobby. Toms brother Michael came into the game and the initial thinking to open a microbrewery were the end of 2007 in the room. The onetime still very amateurish plans were (from the current perspective thankfully) not implemented. The idea persisted, however. And so Tom and John went once to Weihenstephan to study at TUM brewing and beverage technology. In early 2012, the plans were revived and Raphael came on board.

We played different scenarios: Own Brewery vs. Gypsy Brewing, building the brand, and most importantly the recipe development. It quickly became apparent that the construction of their own brewing equipment from the beginning is difficult to achieve and for us the concept as Gypsy Brewer is the path to the goal. After an intensive search for a partner brewery we could start our cooperation with Reinhold Barta Brauhaus cast. Even today, we brew our beers in the casting, and so you could call us sedentary migrant Brauer, because unlike classic Gypsy brewers that produce many breweries (blank), we brew our beers to our ideas almost exclusively in the casting.

Looking ahead, we are aiming for the establishment of our own brewery in Vienna.

breweries.description: Loe's Brewing Company  is a small craft brewery located in Hickory North Carolina. We specialize in handcrafted artisanal lagers and ales. We are one of the smallest breweries in North Carolina and also one of the smallest in the country. We have a 1.5 bbl brewhouse , 1 and 3 bbl fermentation tanks. Being so small we can afford to take more time and effort into our beers. We utilize many ingredients from all over the world, selecting only the finest grains, cultured yeast, fresh whole hops, and  our mountain water that is perfect for producing the best beers possible.  Another advantage of being small is that we can produce a wide variety of styles so our selection will always be changing. We will produce beers that fit the season and year round classics. Loe's Brewing takes pride in producing the finest handcrafted beers, and we are sure that once you try our beer you will agree that bigger is not always better , and will notice the difference that craft beer has to offer. data.name: Vienna-style Lager
data.description: The VSL is a light, easy-drinking German-style lager that showcases a rich, biscuity flavor derived from using 100% Munich malt. The malty notes are balanced by a faint bitterness due to the addition of traditional German Hallertau Mittlefruh hops. Perfect for pairing with a wide variety of meals or simply enjoying with friends on summer nights.

style.name: Vienna-Style Lager
style.description: Beers in this category are reddish brown or copper colored. They are medium in body. The beer is characterized by malty aroma and slight malt sweetness. The malt aroma and flavor should have a notable degree of toasted and/or slightly roasted malt character. Hop bitterness is clean and crisp. Noble-type hop aromas and flavors should be low or mild. Diacetyl, chill haze and ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived.

style.name: Belgian-Style Tripel
style.description: Tripels are often characterized by a complex, sometimes mild spicy character. Clove-like phenolic flavor and aroma may be evident at extremely low levels. Yeast-generated  fruity esters, including banana, are also common, but not necessary. These pale/light-colored ales may finish sweet, though any sweet finish should be light. The beer is characteristically medium and clean in body with an equalizing hop/malt balance and a perception of medium to medium high hop bitterness. Traditional Belgian Tripels are often well attenuated. Brewing sugar may be used to lighten the perception of body. Its sweetness will come from very pale malts. There should not be character from any roasted or dark malts. Low hop flavor is acceptable. Alcohol strength and flavor should be perceived as evident. Head retention is dense and mousse-like. Chill haze is acceptable at low serving temperatures. Traditional Tripels are bottle conditioned, may exhibit slight yeast haze but the yeast should not be intentionally roused. Oxidative character if evident in aged Tripels should be mild and pleasant.

breweries.name: 4 Noses Brewing Company
breweries.description: The 4 Noses Brewery is a family owned and operated craft brewery and tasting room. 4 Noses has a passion for creatively brewing our unique interpretation of classic styles. Using ingredients from around the world, 4 Noses combines traditional styles with nontraditional flavor profiles to give the beers our own distinct personality.

data.name: Vier Söhne
data.description: SGerman in name and German in style, but with the brilliant luminescence of a summertime Southern California sunrise, this radiant golden beauty is our own way of paying homage to our beloved brewing ancestors of Germany. From the Four Sons to you, Prost mein Bruder (Cheers My Brother)!

style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier
style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.

breweries.name: Four Sons Brewing
breweries.description: Four Sons Brewing is a family owned and operated micro-brewery located in Huntington Beach, California (aka Surf City). Our family includes parents Duke and Daune Dufresne and, as you might have guessed by now, their four sons -- Deven, Derek, Drew and Dustin. You can also see why we have been known over the years as the "D Family", or simply "The D's". The family has since expanded with the addition of two daughters-in-law -- Talar and Rachel -- and grandson's Nico (so much for that "D" thing!) and Dillon. We've always been a very close family and love doing things together whether it's vacations, home improvement projects, sporting events, or just hanging out. We've long had a dream of starting our own business, and so we finally decided to take our love of craft beer, combined with our home-brewing experience, to create Four Sons Brewing. The picture below is a shot of the whole group and when you visit our tasting room you will likely see most (if not all) of us there. (Oh, by the way, we are huge LA Kings fans!). So we all invite you to come by, have a beer, and become a part of the Four Sons Family!

data.name: Viertal
data.description: This dark, full-bodied Belgian dark ale will pour a strong black color with ruby highlights and a tan head. Aromas of orange peel, roasted malts and cardamom come through on the nose. The flavor profile is quite sweet with more orange peel, dark fruit, and spice in the finish. *UNFILTERED*

style.name: Belgian-Style Quadrupel
style.description: Quadrupels or "Quads" are characterized by the immense presence of alcohol and balanced flavor, bitterness and aromas. Its color is deep amber to rich chestnut/garnet brown. Often characterized by a mousse-like dense, sometimes amber head will top off a properly poured and served quad. Complex fruity aroma and flavor emerge reminiscent of raisins, dates, figs, grapes, plums often accompanied with a hint of winy character. Caramel, dark sugar and malty sweet flavors and aromas can be intense, not cloying, while complementing fruitiness. Though well attenuated it usually has a full, creamy body. Hop characters do not dominate; low to low-medium bitterness is perceived. Perception of alcohol can be extreme. Clove-like phenolic flavor and aroma should not be evident. Chill haze is acceptable at low serving temperatures. Diacetyl and DMS should not be perceived. Well balanced with savoring/sipping drinkability. Oxidative character if evident in aged Quads should be mild and pleasant.

style.name: Coffee-Flavored Beer
style.description: Coffee beers use coffee in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows coffee to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. If this beer is a classic style with coffee flavor, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Elliott Bay Brewery and Pub
breweries.description:
Elliott Bay Brewing Co. is a family owned company of high quality neighborhood brewpubs in communities throughout the Seattle area.  Owners Todd Carden and Brent Norton met in 1994 while working for the iconic Maritime Pacific Brewing Co. They forged a friendship and explored their common goal and dream of owning and operating their own brewpub. They also met Head Brewer Doug Hindman at Maritime Pacific.
Todd and Brent incorporated the company in November of 1996.   In March 1997 they signed their first lease and began construction of a brewpub in the historic “Junction” of West Seattle.  They opened for business on July 11, 1997.  Doug joined the ranks in September of 1997 and has been Head Brewer ever since.

Over the past thirteen years in West Seattle, Elliott Bay Brewery & Pub has been a leader in sustainability, philanthropic support, and instumental in creating an amazing sense of community in the neighborhoods which it serves.  Elliott Bay Brewhouse and Pub, the companyís second brewpub, opened in Burien in March of 2007.  The Burien Brewhouse, like its West Seattle sibling, supports a progressive company culture and socially responsible business practices.In 2013 Elliott Bay opened its third brewpub location in the Lake City neighborhood of NE Seattle. Together these three brewing locations product about 3,000 barrels each year.

style.name: Specialty Stouts
style.description: See British Origin American-Style Imperial Porter Imperial porters are very dark brown to black in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/astringent black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness should be in harmony with medium-low to medium hop bitterness. This is a full bodied beer. Ale-like fruity esters should be evident but not overpowering and compliment malt derived sweetness and hop character. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being low to medium-high. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

data.name: Vieux Amis
data.description: Bright toasted green cardamom aromas accented by a delicate citrus touch fade into coffee, roast and a subtle sweetness. This beer highlights the Belgian Brown Ale base notes of dried fruits, caramel and cacao nibs before bringing in a hint of apricot and floral notes from the Intelligentsia Ethiopian Kurimi coffee.

style.name: Belgian-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Belgian-style pale ales are characterized by low but noticeable hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Light to medium body and low malt aroma are typical. They are light amber to deep amber in color. Noble-type hops are commonly used. Low to medium fruity esters are evident in aroma and flavor. Low levels of phenolic spiciness from yeast byproducts may be perceived. Low caramel or toasted malt flavor is okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Penrose Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Art, Science, and Belgian-Inspired Brewing in Geneva, IL. 

This began with a shared obsession for skillfully brewed beer, and the starved need for cultural redirection of our lifework. Blissfully content with an opportunity to help refine a discerning palate, preferably with beer in hand, a deeper passion and commitment to the cause has evolved into Penrose Brewing Company. The cultural shift already underway is a by-product of intention and specificity. You will want to be involved.
